reviews.text: I needed to stay just one night in St. Paul and I wanted to be reasonably close to the airport. I was unpleasantly surprised by just how poor condition this property was in. There was a softball sized hole in the rug at the door. The bathroom sink had 1/2 inch gap between the sink/counter and moldy caulk everywhere. It was freezing in the room when I arrived, and probably that was to keep down the mildewy smell that became apparent after turning the heat on. My flight wasn't until 9 a.m., but I was out by 5 a.m. They need to repair and clean this hotel.
reviews.title: Very Poor Condition

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed over night, got a ride to airport. Shuttle both ways was great!
reviews.title: clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rooms were clean , staff was polite. We got a 4am wake up call. Not a fancy place but served the purpose.
reviews.title: Average...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel under the assumption it was the same one I stayed in 3 years ago right across the street from Mall of America, when the GPS took me to this place I was so confused! It turns out the other one closed. The hotel just gave me the creeps, shady looking guest, the closet was falling apart, I couldn't for the life of me get the shower to work. I'm glad I was only there for 9 hours. I will not be choosing a cheap motel again unless it has good reviews. I do not recommend.
reviews.title: Not for me

reviews.text: Delta Airlines put us up here after a 5 hour delay in Amsterdam caused us to miss our connection. Nice lobby area and attractive pool. Friendly staff. BUT - hallways are forbidding and scary. Rooms are old tired and dirty. Stained carpets, sleazy bedspreads, chipped and broken furniture, Black mold in bath. No elevator - 2-story army barracks style building. Chilis is next door and they take airline vouchers (Delta gave us $6 for a meal!). Delta should be ashamed for putting their passengers in this motel. To be fair they did get us to and from the airport and the staff was nice, considering what they had to work with. Breakfast was OK with the usual emphasis on carbs.
reviews.title: Dreadful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to see a Twins game and decided to stay out of the city cause of price. The room was clean. The property could use a little updating. The have free shuttle to Mall of America and the airport. We used the shuttle to go to the mall and rode the train into the game. They picked us up at the airport on our on return from the game. The receptionist at the front desk was very nice and helped me with any questions I had. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice stay at a nice motel.

reviews.text: I was stranded at MSP airport (dont ask my rating for that!) and this is the hotel they put me in. It was "old but clean." There is a shuttle. TIP: look on both sides of the waiting area for the shuttle, I may have missed the first one. Quick check in process. THere were about 15 of us, and the clerk had a pile of keys, took our voucher, gave us a key. Less than 10 seconds. Just what i needed after that day.Ok breakfast.
reviews.title: Old but clean

reviews.text: Choose hotel because of the park and ride offer. Had to wait 50 minutes for ride when calling for shuttle from airport. Rooms were shabby - stain on carpeting. Beds and pillows not comfortable. Price was fair, but would find another hotel next time.
reviews.title: Unhappy
